text: Ingrid steps out of the car, wearing running shoes and a cocktail dress underneath her sweatshirt. We TRACK with h as she makes her way across the lawn, towards a large TEN filled with tables and people dancing. Ingrid weaves her way through the crowd, unnoticed. She grabs a glass of champagne from a passing caterer and slu it, tossing the empty glass aside as she notices --
-- sitting at her table, still in her wedding dress, tell an animated story to a group of enthralled WEDDING GUESTS
Hi Charlotte. Charlotte and a few of her guests turn, smiling. Charlott recognizes Ingrid and just as suddenly her smile vanishes
Ingrid...?
Congratulations. Ingrid holds up a PEPPER SPRAY GUN and blasts Charlotte i the face. Charlotte squeezes her eyes shut, screaming.

The party erupts into chaos. Charlotte’s bridesmaids rush her aid. Ingrid tries to make a run for it but is tackled the dance floor by a couple of athletic GROOMSMEN. CLOSE on Ingrid writhing on the floor and sobbing as we -
A STATIC SHOT of the Pacific Ocean shimmering under a pin and orange sky. We HEAR the sound of waves crashing again the shoreline as the TITLE FADES IN --
We PULL BACK to reveal that the beach is a motivational poster hanging on an otherwise empty wall.
Dear Charlotte. A calmer, healthier-looking Ingrid sits on the edge of a bed inside the sterile room, staring up at the poster. Sh looks down at the notebook in her lap and continues writi
I just want you to know how sorry I am about what happened.
Ingrid steps up to a window where a nurse hands her a pap cup filled with medicine. She tosses back her pills and opens her mouth wide, sticking out her tongue.
In a lot of ways, having this time apart has been good for me. It’s given me a chance to reflect.
Ingrid plays ping-pong against a pale 15-YEAR-OLD GIRL.
I’m learning how to be present.
Ingrid is eating a sandwich and reading a worn copy of Th Language of Letting Go, highlighting her favorite passage
How to live in the moment.
Ingrid sits in a circle with a small group, nodding in sympathy as a female patient shares a harrowing story.
How to listen.
Ingrid and her fellow patients are sitting in chairs watc Clueless on a pull-down projector screen. Ingrid laughs, then pauses, remembering something.
Sometimes I’1l hear a joke or see something that reminds me of you and I feel sad because I have no way of telling you about it.
Ingrid sits cross-legged, meditating next to a large oak
But maybe that’s okay. Maybe it’s good to feel alone once in a while.
Ingrid waves goodbye to the other patients, exchanging hu
I don’t know what the future holds for me. I just know that things are going to be different now.

Ingrid is waiting at the front desk clutching a faded L.L Bean backpack with her name stitched across the top. She makes sure no one is watching then reaches over the count and slides a stamped envelope into the OUTGOING MAIL bin.

Hopefully someday you and I can look back on all of this and laugh. A NURSE appears, handing Ingrid a plastic bag filled with personal items. Ingrid opens the bag, taking out her IPHO CLOSE on the phone. We SEE Ingrid’s face reflected in the glass. She cradles it in her hand, caressing the screen.
Your friend, always --

Ingrid! Ingrid turns, snapping out of her reverie. HER POV - Ingrid’s sister, ERIN, 32, pregnant and dressed catalog casual, stands in the lobby. She waves, hopeful. I/E. ERIN’S SUV (MOVING) - DAY Erin drives while Ingrid rides shotgun with her head out window, staring out at the Pennsylvania suburbs as they p by. She notices a Corona billboard with the slogan “Find Your Beach” and smiles.
Sorry I’m late. I had to pull Logan out of karate class. His sensei had a cold sore. Ingrid turns towards the backseat, still glowing.
How’s my little black belt, huh? Erin’s son, LOGAN, 4, sits in the back with headphones on staring at his iPad. He doesn’t look up.
Oh, by the way, if anyone asks, we told people you were at a yoga retreat.  6. Ingrid looks at Erin, confused. She laughs uncomfortably.
For eight weeks?
We thought it’d be easier for you to not have to keep explaining to everyone where you were.
Yeah, the thing is... a big part of the healing process is learning how to talk about what happened and not care what other people think.
Totally get it. Keith and I just feel like all the hospital stuff might be a little heavy for Logan. He’s only in Pre-K.
So what? You want me to pretend like everything's perfect?
No! Of course not. You can talk about it as much as you want. Just as long as we're talking about yoga and not, you know... Ingrid is silent. This doesn’t sit well with her.
So... do you want to talk about it?

Not anymore. They continue driving in silence. Ingrid turns back towar the window, her glow fading a bit. EXT. ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - ESTABLISHING A single-story Colonial house with a big yard. A police motorcycle is parked next to Erin’s SUV in the driveway.  INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - DAY The door opens and Erin’s husband KEITH, 39, enters weari short-sleeved cop uniform, his shirt unbuttoned revealing white tee underneath. He flicks on the light.

-- and last but not least, I give you the Ingrid Suite. Voila. Ingrid enters, looking around, with Erin close behind. HER POV - A baby’s nursery has been transformed into a temporary guest room. There is a cozy-looking bed with fr flowers on the nightstand, a flat-screen TV, a basket fil with snacks and a banner that reads: “WELCOME HOME, INGRI
(touched) You guys, this is so nice.
Stay as long as you want.
Our casa is su casa.
You didn’t have to do all this. I’1ll only be here a few days. Ingrid sets down her backpack and opens the closet. Erin Keith exchange a worried look.
Where were you planning on going?
(read: obviously) Back to Mom’s house? Where all my stuff is? Ingrid turns on the closet light and pauses. It’s filled with clothes and cardboard boxes labeled: “INGRID”
We were gonna wait until you were settled in to tell you but --
(ripping off the band-aid) We sold the house, Ingrid.  Ingrid stares at them, completely blindsided.
Erin and Keith are standing outside the bathroom door.
Half that house was mine! She left it to both of us!
Exactly. Which is why we put half of the money in a checking account under your name.
Big ol’ chunk of change, Ingrid. No response.
We figured you could use it. How else were we supposed to pay for all your medical bills? The door flies open and Ingrid appears, eyes red.
Don’t you mean my yoga retreat?!
Easy, Ingrid --
No! Ever since Mom died, you guys have been waiting to kick me out. You just couldn't help yourselves, could you?!
Ingy, that house was a dump. It was not a healthy environment for you. Ingrid sits on the bed and closes her eyes, doing a breat exercise, trying to calm herself.
I'd like to be alone now, please.
(to Erin) Why don’t you tell her how much we got for it?
Why don’t you go fuck yourself? Silence. Erin gives Keith a look telling him to wait outs
Okey-dokey. Keith exits. Erin sits next to Ingrid on the bed.
Look, I know how close you were with Mom. I can’t even imagine how hard that must have been for you. And after what happened with Charlotte --
Erin...
My point is, try and see this as an opportunity. A chance to put all that negativity behind you and start fresh. You can build a whole new life for yourself. The life you always wanted.
I don’t know what life I want.

Don’t worry. It’ll come to you. Ingrid says nothing. Erin takes her cue and exits, leavin behind a BANK FOLDER with Ingrid’s name on it. Ingrid buries her face in a pillow and SCREAMS. She lies there for a moment, then tosses the pillow aside, pulling her phone and powering it on. The warm glow of the screen lights up her face as she stares at it longingly. ON THE SCREEN - She opens Instagram and searches @badcharlotte. Charlotte’s profile appears with a message “This User Is Private.” Ingrid sighs. She lies back on the bed, listening to the muffled family sounds downstairs, feeling empty and alone  10.

ECU: A series of items being scanned -- an at-home facial kit, a bag of gummy worms, the latest issue of Vanity Fai six-pack of Corona, a bottle of prescription pills... Ingrid stands at the pharmacy counter with her earbuds in listening to an audiobook while a PHARMACIST rings her up

Maybe our pain is showing us we need to set a boundary. Maybe it’s showing us we’re going in a wrong direction... Ingrid looks up to see two of CHARLOTTE’S FRIENDS (JENNY NICOLE) walking past. They make knowing eye contact with Ingrid, who quickly turns the other way. The pharmacist hands Ingrid a plastic bag. She grabs it, throwing down cash and making a beeline for the exit.

It’s okay to feel hurt; it’s okay to cry; it’s okay to heal; it’s okay to move on to the next feeling, when it’s time... Ingrid is almost to the door when she sees Jenny and Nico rounding the corner right in front of her. Ingrid hides behind a cardboard display filled with candy. We HOLD on Ingrid’s face as she waits for them to pass, removing her earbuds so she can hear them whispering --
-- what is up with her hair?
Seriously. Who’s your stylist? Helen Keller? They laugh. Ingrid touches her hair self-consciously.
Didn't they send her to an insane asylum?
Yep. Her sister told everyone she was at a yoga retreat.
So dark.  11. They disappear around a corner. Ingrid puts her earbuds b in and heads for the exit, trying not to show any emotion

Today, I will not strike out at those who cause me pain. TI will feel my emotions and take responsibility for them... I/E. NICOLE’S CAR - MOMENTS LATER A popsicle stick picture frame with a photo of Nicole and family dangles from the rearview mirror. We RACK FOCUS to Ingrid through the windshield as she exi the drugstore, recognizing Nicole's car.

Ingrid makes sure no one is watching, then reaches into h purse and pulls out Erin’s CAR KEY. She drags the key alo the length of Nicole’s car, leaving a jagged white scratc I/E. ERIN’S SUV - EVENING Ingrid is parked in a suburban housing development, eatin gummy worms and staring out the window. HER POV - A brand-new two-story home. Charlotte and her husband exit, carrying a wrapped gift and a bottle of win As they get into their car, Charlotte glances over at us Ingrid ducks down. She peers over the steering wheel. HER POV - Charlotte is squinting in our direction. She whispers to her husband, who looks over at us, alarmed. Ingrid throws the car into reverse, knocking over a garba bin. She jams on the gas and peels off, tires squealing. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is lying in the bathtub, drinking a Corona, wearin green face mask and flipping through her copy of Vanity F She pauses on an article featuring a photo of a confident bohemian-looking young woman in faded overalls sitting cr legged on her front porch. The headline reads:

head_text.subj: MEET TAYLOR SLOANE, YOUR NEWEST GIRL CRUSH

text: CLOSE on the photo of TAYLOR SLOANE, 29. Her elegant beau is offset by an effortless style and laid-back warmth. CLOSE on Ingrid’s face. Something inside her has shifted. She is transfixed. Who is this perfect-looking creature? INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - MINUTES LATER Ingrid is in bed with her phone and a towel around her he ON THE SCREEN - She types the name “Taylor Sloane” into t Instagram search bar. Her handle pops up - @welltaylored. Ingrid opens Taylor's profile. She has 267K followers.
Whoa. She taps on Taylor’s most recent PHOTO.
A PHOTO of Taylor on a beach in Malibu, wearing a haltern swimsuit and covering her face with her hands --
“Live in the sunshine, swim in the sea, drink the wild air.” Ralph Waldo Emerson. A SLOW-MO VIDEO of her dog, ROTHKO, hanging out the windo an old Mercedes, tongue flapping, speeding through L.A. -
My muse. Hashtag Rothko The Dog. A PHOTO of the sun setting over a perfectly-restored dese cabin in Joshua Tree --
There is science, logic and reason. And then there is... California. A VIDEO of a TALL HANDSOME GUY with long ombre hair (EZRA setting off bottle rockets on a rooftop in Downtown L.A.
Baby, you’re a firework. American Flag emoji.  13. A PHOTO of Taylor and Ezra wearing Jean-Luc Godard-inspir Halloween costumes --

Pierrot Le Fou? Oui. We see perfectly-composed PHOTOS of Los Angeles, Joshua T vintage cars, flower arrangements, whimsically-patterned wallpaper, Navajo rugs, designer shoes, artisanal cocktai restaurants, music festivals, travel, travel, more TRAVEL We see VIDEOS of Taylor showing off her house, riding aro Venice on a beach cruiser, being interviewed for Vanity F

head_text.subj: TAYLOR'S LIFE, HER VOICE OVERLAPPING WITH ITSELF, THE IMA

text: A VIDEO of Taylor on her wedding day in Big Sur. She stan at the altar wearing a 1930s lace dress and flower crown across from Ezra who wears a white tux and black felt hat

.-. You may now kiss the bride. Taylor and Ezra kiss. It’s an incredibly intimate moment. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - EARLY MORNING Ingrid is watching the video in bed, wiping away tears. ECU: Her thumb presses the ‘Follow’ button. INT. LIVING ROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - DAY Ingrid and Logan are on the couch in their pajamas watchi cartoons while Erin makes dinner in the background. Ingri scrolls through Taylor’s Instagram on her phone. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of an enchilada on top of a plate emblazoned with the phrase “What are you grateful for?” -
I Am Grateful for this vegan enchilada with raw cacao mole sauce. Praying hands emoji. Ingrid taps on the ‘Comment’ bubble, thinking of what to We hear INGRID’S VOICE as she types --  14.
Damn, girl! That looks yummy. What’s your email address? Ingrid pauses. Something doesn’t feel right. She deletes her comment and tries again.
I am SUCH a foodie. Should we be best friends? Ingrid frowns. Still not right. She tries again.

OMG! Where is this place?? She adds a ‘Licking Lips’ emoji to the end of her comment Ingrid smiles. Nailed it. She presses SEND. Keith enters from the garage, taking off his cop helmet, serious look on his face.
Hey, Ingrid, can I talk to you for a second? In private? Ingrid freezes, looking worried.
Ingrid and Keith are standing in the hallway, whispering.
Did you stop by Charlotte’s house yesterday?
No.
Ingrid. Don’t lie to me.
I’m not lying.
Should I get Erin in here? Maybe you'd feel more comfortable telling her what happened. Erin appears in the doorway, drying her hands with a towe  15.
Tell me what?
I got a call from Charlotte’s lawyer this morning. Apparently she saw Ingrid lurking outside her house last night.
(defensive) I wasn’t lurking. I was just feeling low and I wanted to see if she got my letter --
You sent her a letter?!
Ingrid, why would you do that?!
I needed to apologize and let her know there were no hard feelings.
What do you mean no hard feelings?
I mean, none of this would’ve happened if she’d just invited me to her wedding in the first place. Keith and Erin stare at Ingrid, dumbfounded.
Ingrid, Charlotte didn’t invite you because you’re not her friend. She's just a girl we went to high school with who reached out to you after Mom died. That’s it!
I’m sorry, okay? It won’t happen again.
That is such bullshit!
Babe, calm down --  16.

No, I can’t do this anymore. (to Ingrid) It’s clear you don’t want our help so you know what? I’m done. Do whatever you want. This is your problem, not ours. Erin storms off. Keith gives Ingrid one last disapproving glance and exits. Ingrid stands there, looking hurt. INT. BATHROOM - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is sitting on the toilet, crying softly to herself Her phone BUZZES. She looks down. A new notification. ON THE SCREEN - Taylor has responded to Ingrid’s comment.
Cafe Gratitude. It’s the best. Come check it out next time you’re in L.A.! Winking face emoji.

Ingrid’s expression changes. She smiles, wiping away tear INT. NURSERY - ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT Ingrid is staring at the Vanity Fair profile of Taylor. HER POV - The caption beneath the photo reads “Taylor and dog, Rothko, at home in Venice, California.” PUNCH IN on the words: “Venice, California."

Ingrid opens the bank folder Erin left her and checks her account balance sheet. We scroll down a page filled with useless financial jargon until we land on -- “AVAILABLE BALANCE: $91,234.21” Ingrid stares at the number in disbelief.

Ingrid watches, mesmerized, as $100 bills are spit out of counting machine and arranged into neat piles by a BRANCH MANAGER. One by one, Ingrid places the stacks of money in her old L.L. Bean backpack.  17. EXT. ERIN AND KEITH’S HOUSE - NIGHT The house is asleep. A window opens on the top floor and Ingrid’s backpack is tossed out onto the lawn followed by duffel bag. Ingrid climbs out, carefully lowering herself the ground. She grabs her bags and runs to a waiting CAB.

The Pacific Ocean shimmers under a pink and orange sky, w crashing against the shoreline. We PULL BACK to reveal Ingrid sitting in the sand with he bags, staring out at the sea. She looks down at her phone ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid is creating a new Instagram accoun The cursor blinks in the empty ‘Username’ field. She thin for a moment, then types in the words:

Ingrid Goes West. Her new profile POPS UP. A completely blank canvas. Ingrid raises her phone, snapping a picture of the sunris She pauses, thinking of the perfect caption. She glances around, her eyes landing on a CORONA AD plast to the side of a nearby building, then types:
Finally found my beach. Happy face emoji. ECU: Ingrid’s thumb presses the ‘Share’ button.

QUICK SHOTS of Ingrid pedaling a brand-new beach cruiser through the streets of Venice, soaking it all in. She pauses in front of an old Victorian house. There is a brand-new black pick-up truck parked out front with a Bat symbol in place of the Toyota emblem. A sign posted in th yard reads: “AVAILABLE: 1 BR + 1 BATH"  18.

Ingrid looks around while the owner, DAN PINTO, 34, rides two-wheeled scooter around, talking on his phone and puff on a vape pen. He wears a flat-brim hat, an XXL Jordan Bu jersey, board shorts and Adidas slides with tube socks.

(into phone) Last night was haywire, dude. You see that girl I was talking to? Total smoke show. Bounced her back to my place for some YouTube and chill. We were up all night. Pinto glances over at Ingrid, clearly saying this for her benefit, but she isn’t paying attention at all.
Nah, we didn’t hook up, but it’s all good. I’m juggling too many bitches right now anyway. Gotta whittle down my body count -- Ingrid clears her throat. Pinto lowers his voice.
Hey listen, I gotta run but hit me up later if you wanna blaze. (awkward beat) Okay, yeah, no worries. Maybe some other time -- (beat) Hello...? Jeremy? Pinto hangs up and turns to Ingrid.
Bad connection. (extends his hand) Hey. Dan Pinto.
Ingrid. (confused beat) Are you the landlord?
I don’t really like the term landlord. Just think of me as the chill guy who lives next door and collects rent every month.  19.
But... this is your place, right?

It’s really more of a side hustle to keep me cash-positive while I pursue my true passion. Pinto hands her a card that reads “DAN PINTO // SCREENWRI in Batman Forever font with all of his social media handl
You write movies? Pinto nods, exhaling a thick cloud of smoke from his vape
Anything I’ve seen?
You familiar with Batman?
Wow. You wrote that?

Not exactly. But I am working on a script for a new installment in the franchise. It ain’t exactly “authorized” but my producer Jeremy used to be Joel Schumacher’s assistant and he pretty much guaranteed he'd forward it along once I finish this new draft. Ingrid has already stopped listening and is making her wa into the bedroom. Pinto chases after her.
How much is this place?
All business, huh? C’mon, Ingrid. (Dr. Evil voice) Throw me a frickin’ bone here! Pinto grins, expecting a laugh. Ingrid looks uneasy.

(clearing his throat) It’s, uh, twenty-nine hundred a month plus two month’s security deposit. No pets allowed but we are most certainly 420-friendly.  Pinto offers Ingrid a hit of his vape pen. Silence.
No thanks.
Very cool. I'’11 just run a quick credit check and I’1l also need some proof of income --

Can I pay you in cash? Pinto seems impressed and a little turned on. INT. PINTO’S HOUSE - DAY 20. The place is a glorified dorm room filled with wall-to-wa Batman merchandise, framed posters of classic 90s movies “The Matrix” and “12 Monkeys” and a giant fish tank. Pinto watches as Ingrid digs through her backpack, counti out nine grand in cash on a table littered with weed jars
Don’t take this the wrong way, but... are you a prostitute?
Nope.
Drug dealer? (no response) ‘Cause if you were, my producer Jeremy has a legit hook-up --
I’m not a drug dealer, okay? My mom died and she left me some money and I just want to start over. Pinto takes a solemn drag on his vape pen. Ingrid hands him the cash.
My condolences.
Thanks. He smiles, handing her the keys.  21.
Welcome to La La Land, Ingrid. (pause) So, uh... what are your plans the rest of the day? Wanna grab some In & Out animal-style? My treat.
I’m pretty tired but thanks anyway. Ingrid heads for the door. Pinto calls out after her.
If you need help moving, lemme know and I’1l fire up the Batmobile.
Okay! Will do. Ingrid exits quickly, the screen door slamming behind her
Peace out, roomie!

Ingrid stands inside her empty apartment, looking around contentedly. Her phone DINGS. A new notification POPS UP: “@officialdanpinto is now following you.” Ingrid opens Pinto’s profile. A measly 178 followers. She taps on his most recent post. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of Pinto at Six Flags, crouching throwing up double peace signs in front of BATMAN: THE RI

Six Flags solo mission. Shit just got real. Ingrid frowns. She opens Taylor's page instead, pulling u her vegan enchilada photo. She taps on the geotag for “Ca Gratitude” and a MAP appears showing the exact location.
Ingrid sits at a table alone. She cranes her neck, lookin around for any sign of Taylor.  22.
What’s your biggest emotional wound? Ingrid turns. A WAITRESS with a nose ring is smiling at h
I'm sorry?

That’s our question of the day. She points to a chalkboard hanging on the wall that reads “Today’s Question: What is your biggest emotional wound?” WAITRESS (CONT’D) Mine’s my relationship with my dad. It’s cool if you don’t want to answer. We have to ask everyone who comes in. Company policy.
Uh... I’m good, thanks.
In that case, welcome to Gratitude! My name’s Eden. How can I nourish you today?
I’m meeting a friend of mine for lunch. Have you seen her? Ingrid holds up a PHOTO of Taylor on her phone that’s bee cropped to look like an original.
Taylor Sloane? Yeah, she comes in all the time. She was just here like an hour ago. (confused) You say you’re meeting her for lunch?
Oh, uh... shoot. I must have gotten the time wrong. (quick beat) Do you remember what she ordered?

Ingrid sits in front of a plate of yam cauliflower samosa concentrating as she takes a birds-eye PHOTO of it. ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid posts the photo on her Instagram account. We HEAR her voice as she types out the caption:

Well, I made it. Thanks for the rec @welltaylored! Hashtag I Am Grateful. Ingrid taps ‘Share’ and smiles, feeling good about hersel Ingrid sets down her phone to take her first bite. She immediately gags, spitting the half-chewed food onto her plate, drawing stares from some of the other customers.

Ingrid sits cross-legged on the floor of her empty apartm eating an In-N-Out burger and looking at Instagram. ON THE SCREEN - A street-style PHOTO of Taylor in front o row of surfboards, wearing a linen sack dress, suede boot and a straw hat, holding a Claire Vivier clutch.
New @stevenalan threads got me like... Princess emoji.
Ingrid walks out wearing the exact same outfit as Taylor carrying two shopping bags. She looks down at her phone. ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of Taylor getting a haircut.
Summer chop courtesy of the lovely ladies @trimsalon.

Ingrid sits in a chair, scrolling through her phone, as t stylist applies highlights to her hair with bits of tin f ON THE SCREEN - A PHOTO of a first edition of Joan Didion The White Album framed next to an Intelligentsia coffee c  24.
“We tell ourselves stories in order to live.” Joan Didion.

Ingrid is at the coffee bar, hair styled exactly like Taylor's, sipping a latte and reading a first edition of White Album. Her phone DINGS. A notification POPS UP: “@officialdanpinto has commented on your post.” ON THE SCREEN - Ingrid swipes on the notification. Her PH from Cafe Gratitude appears, now with one like from Pinto
Cauliflower samosa game on fleek. Devil Horns emoji. Ingrid sighs, disappointed.
Ingrid is wearing sweats and flip-flops, her hair in a me bun, grabbing a sixer of Coronas out of the fridge. As th door closes, she hears a familiar voice and turns to see
-- standing at the register, buying a New York Times and making small talk with the CASHIER.

-+. I love the feel of ink on paper. It’s so tactile. Ingrid turns back around, trying not to freak out. She pu out her phone and uses the front-facing camera to check h appearance then immediately closes it, disgusted.

Okay. Relax. Just be cool. (cheerful voice) Hey! How are you?! I’m a huge fan! Fuck... (beat) Oh my god! Hi! It’s me! Ingrid! No! Shut up! Just be yourself... A MOM pushing a stroller comes around the corner. She see Ingrid standing there with her eyes closed, muttering to herself, and immediately turns the other way.  25. Ingrid takes a deep breath and turns, opening her eyes. A she looks at the counter, her expression changes. HER POV - Taylor is gone.

Ingrid rushes out of the store looking both ways. HER POV - We PAN AROUND frantically then ZOOM IN on Taylo across the street, walking into a store. Ingrid is about to cross the street when Pinto cruises by his pick-up truck, grinning, music thumping.
‘Sup, Ingrid! Ingrid tries to see past Pinto’s truck, but it’s too big.
Get out of the way! Pinto watches, confused, as Ingrid dashes across the busy intersection, cars honking as she runs past.
An upscale Venice boutique. Taylor is browsing a table of knickknacks. Ingrid walks up, eyeing Taylor and pretendin to flip through a coffee table book about bread.
Mmmm. This looks so bread. Ingrid winces, realizing her mistake. Taylor looks up.
Sorry?

I mean good. This bread looks so good. (awkward) Sounds like somebody didn’t have their coffee this morning! Ingrid forces a laugh. Taylor smiles politely and looks away. Ingrid remains frozen, a grin plastered on her face
I think I'll buy this.  26. Taylor pretends not to hear her. Ingrid approaches the register, glancing back at Taylor longingly.

Taylor is walking with her earbuds plugged in, scrolling through her phone. In the background, we see Ingrid following her at a safe distance. EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Taylor opens the gate of her beautiful Craftsman house, checking the mail. There is an Airstream and a vintage Mercedes in the driveway. A dog YAPS from inside. Ingrid hides behind a parked car, watching Taylor as she enters her house. Ingrid pauses, noticing something. HER POV - Taylor’s dog, ROTHKO, sits at the window, panti EXT. TAYLOR’S HOUSE - NIGHT Taylor exits, followed by her husband, EZRA O'KEEFE, 33, sporting an impressive beard. They hop into Taylor's Mercedes and she backs out of the driveway.

She watches them from the shadows of a nearby alleyway, holding an In-N-Out bag and sucking on a milkshake. Ingrid tip-toes up to the gate, looking both ways. Rothko appears at the window, BARKING incessantly. Ingrid crouch low, hurrying around the side of the house. She tries one the windows. Locked. Then another. Also locked. Ingrid continues around to the back of the house, trying every window until finally one OPENS revealing a small po room. Ingrid tries climbing inside but it’s too small.
Rothko comes sprinting up to the window with his teeth ba Ingrid pulls out a loose hamburger patty, holding it up.
Here! Want some? Rothko stops barking and sits, eyes trained on the patty. Ingrid dangles the meat inside the window, just out of hi reach. Rothko JUMPS up and down, trying to get at it.  27.
Come on, Rothko. Come on, boy... Ingrid grabs Rothko mid-jump, pulling him outside.
ECU: Rothko’s face, barking incessantly. Ingrid stands above him, desperately trying to placate hi

(hissing) Shh! Please stop barking! There’s a KNOCK at the front door. Ingrid looks startled. She grabs Rothko, looking around frantically, placing him the cabinet under the sink. She tosses an already-opened of Flamin’ Hot Cheetos inside and shuts the cabinet door.
The front door opens, revealing Pinto.
Hey, sorry to bug you, but... did you by any chance get a dog? Ingrid stares at Pinto blankly.
Nope.
Oh... Really? Maybe it’s the kush talking but I swear I heard barking coming from your place.
I was watching a movie. About dogs.
Like Beethoven?
Yes! Beethoven! Love that movie.

What! Me too! Wanna finish it at my place? We can take my new bubbler for a test drive.  28. Before Ingrid can respond, Rothko wanders into the living room with orange dust all over his face, violently rippin apart the Cheetos bag. Pinto gives Ingrid a look.
My friend asked if I could dog-sit for a few days.
Yeahhhh. Unfortunately, it’s kind of a “no dog” situation up in here.

Ingrid tries to quickly walk past them when someone steps her sheet, pulling it off her in one fell swoop. She scrambles to cover herself when Taylor looks over, confus

Ingrid...? Ingrid covers herself with the sheet, pretending not to h TAYLOR (CONT’D) Ingrid, I can see you. We all can. Everyone turns, staring at Ingrid. Ingrid slowly removes sheet, trying to play it cool.  114.
Hey, Taylor. Happy Halloween.
What are you doing here? You weren’t invited.
The music was really loud, so... if you wouldn't mind keeping it down, I have an important meeting tomorrow, SO...
A meeting for what?

(sadly) What the fuck do you care? A dude starts filming the confrontation with his phone. Ezra appears from inside, sporting a new short haircut an moustache and dressed as Bernie from Weekend at Bernie’s.
You want me to call the cops?
It’s fine.
(re: Ezra) You're still with this guy?
Not that it’s any of your business, but our marriage is fine. Unlike you, we’re working through our issues.
I’m ninety days sober.
(proudly) Ezra’s a concept designer for Levis.
I know, I saw your Instagram. Congratulations.  115.
Go home, Ingrid. People like you aren’t welcome here. Ingrid starts to leave then pauses, turning.

Ezra told me everything, you know. How you used to dress like a sorority girl. How your favorite band was Coldplay. How when you moved here you didn’t have any friends. You were just like me. Ezra says nothing. Taylor looks at Ingrid with pity.
I was never like you, Ingrid. A long, painful silence. Everyone stares down at their fe CLOSE on Ingrid, fighting back tears. She nods, taking a deep breath, steeling herself...

If you could keep the music down I'd really appreciate it. Ingrid walks back towards her house. She pauses, turning around. Everyone watches as she walks across the entire party and unplugs her phone.

Forgot my phone. Ingrid exits once again. A long beat, then -- Everyone resumes dancing and partying as if nothing happe We TRACK with Ingrid as she walks across the desert, the party continuing behind her, tears running down her cheek

ECU: A cheap tealight candle being lit with a match. Ingrid is seated on the floor of her now-spotless living room, surrounded by lit candles. She stares at her phone. POV —- THROUGH AN IPHONE CAMERA We are CLOSE on Ingrid’s face as she presses the red RECO button on an Instagram video. She takes a deep breath.  116.

They say that friends are the family you choose, but... What if the people you choose don’t choose you? (pause) I thought moving to L.A. would be my chance to start over. A chance to live the life I always wanted -- The video STOPS at the 15-second limit. Ingrid sighs. She presses ‘Share’ and hits the record button again.

I thought if I made my life seem perfect and happy, maybe someone would choose me, but... it didn’t matter. I guess the problem is me. The only person who ever chose me is gone now, so... why even bother? (pause) I’m so tired -- The video STOPS recording.
shit! Ingrid presses ‘Share’ and hits the record button again.

I'm tired of having to pretend to be something I’m not. I guess the reason I’m doing this is because I wanted to show people the real me, if only this one time. So... (shrugs ) Here I am. Silence. Ingrid picks up a bottle of prescription pills a dumps it into her mouth, washing it down with a Corona an wincing. She hits the ‘Share’ button and sets down her ph Ingrid lies back onto the floor, surrounded by candles, a presses play on her laptop. Seal’s “KISS FROM A ROSE” pla She sets up the framed Instagram photo of her and Taylor smiles at it one last time. She leans her head back and closes her eyes, drifting away, finally at peace...
Ingrid? (beat) Ingrid? Can you hear me?
CLOSE on Ingrid’s eyes. After a beat, they flutter open.. HER POV - A NURSE is hovering over us, smiling warmly.
There she is. Ingrid looks down at her body, realizing she is in a hosp bed. She tries to sit up but the nurse eases her back dow NURSE (CONT’D) Whoa, whoa. Slow down, girl.
(groggy) Where’s my phone...? Ingrid glances around the room. It is filled with FLOWERS BALLOONS, CARDS and STUFFED ANIMALS.
(re: gifts) What’s this?
Apparently you’ve got a lot of fans out there. As a matter of fact, one of them is here to see you. Ingrid stares at the nurse, confused.
Taylor...? We HEAR the sound of a motorized wheelchair coming down t hall. DAN PINTO enters, wearing a halo brace. He smiles.
‘Sup, Ingrid! Ingrid seems disappointed.
Dan’s the reason you’re still with us. You're a lucky girl.  118.
I saw your three-part suicide note on Instagram and called 9-1-1. Ingrid stares at him, bewildered.
You still follow me? Pinto looks at her as if he doesn’t understand the questi
‘Course. You’re my girl, Ingrid. Ingrid looks touched. Her eyes well up with tears.
I’ll leave you two alone. She smiles at them and exits.
Whaddya think of my new wheels? Pinto spins around in his wheelchair.
Turns out getting my neck broken was the best thing that ever happened to me. I had so much time on my hands that I completely retooled my script. And guess what?
You sold it?
Not quite. But people are really responding to the material. I have an agent now and I just got staffed on a TV show. How sick is that? Ingrid manages a weak smile.
That’s great, Dan. I’m really happy for you. Pinto frowns, sensing something is not right.  119.

Hey. Why so serious? (smiles) I know what’1ll cheer you up. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out INGRID’S PHONE. Ingrid’s face lights up. She looks at the home screen. He notification list is flooded with comments from people on Instagram. A headline at the top reads: “You have 27,683 new followers.” Ingrid stares at the number in disbelief.

Some chick from the Huffington Post got hold of your suicide vids and re-posted the shit out of ‘em. Your face is all over the internet. You’ve even got your own hashtag. (beat) Hashtag... I Am Ingrid. Ingrid opens up her Instagram. As she scrolls through all the comments, we HEAR each one being read aloud:
We love you, Ingrid!!!
Stay strong, Ingrid. Flex emoji.
Hello, Ingrid. I’m from Argentina. I saw your video. I think you are beautiful inside and outside.
I feel like we should be best friends. Please follow me?

head_text.subj: THE VOICES START TO BLEND TOGETHER, WORDS OF ENCOURAGEMEN
AND PRAISE COMING FASTER AND FASTER...

text: CLOSE on Ingrid as she feels this outpouring of love from Many complete strangers. Her heart swells. Her breath shortens. Her face scrunches up as tears roll down her cheeks. A SMILE spreads across Ingrid’s face as we -- CUT TO BLACK.
